fields_of_interest: Consumers, Environment, Public Health, Food Safety, Climate Action
head_office_address: Second Floor Blenheim Court 19 George Street
eu_initiatives: Member of the EU platform on food waste and food losses.
organisation_name: The Waste and Resources Action Programme (WRAP)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: EU Platform on Food Losses and Food Waste#E03421#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3421#Member#C#Sub-group to support EU activites on measurements of food waste
relevant_communication: WRAP’s work on food waste is underpinned by groundbreaking, evidence-based research and includes: leading UK-level voluntary agreements with the retail grocery sector and hospitality industry (for example through the Courtauld Commitment 2025);  running the highly successful consumer-facing campaign, Love Food Hate Waste;  working with European partners to quantify, reduce and get more value from food waste across the whole supply chain (FP7 FUSIONS and H2020 REFRESH); partnering with the United Nations Environmental Programme (UNEP) on its  Think.Eat.Save campaign;  and bringing together like-minded organisations to create a global network focussed on making grocery products more sustainable.  see www.wrap.org.uk for more information.
goals__remit:
Established as a not-for-profit company in 2000 to deliver a step change increase in the low recycling rates across the UK, WRAP is now a registered charity with a broadened role of waste prevention, resource efficiency and the sustainability of products and materials. Our mission is to accelerate the move to a sustainable resource-efficient economy both in the UK and internationally through: 
•    re-inventing how we design, produce and sell products,  
•    re-thinking how we use and consume products, and  
•    re-defining what is possible through recycling and re-use 
 
We act as a catalyst, accelerating change in the behaviour of consumers and the public and private sectors in the key areas of: food and drink; resource management; and manufactured goods (in particular textiles and electricals).
